There's a general store where a few players are loitering, and you find an NPC behind the counter. As you begin cycling through your inventory, you recall the guardsman you met mentioning “cred-sinks”. It's unlikely that any player other than the newest would want any of the junk you're hauling around, but his statement implied that money delivered to NPCs leaves the economy—so much of what you've seen thus far involves players purchasing things from other players, whereas selling items to NPCs and finding loot in dungeons dumps credits into the economy... You're overthinking this for sure.

The NPC is about half your height: orange-furred, with a pair of thick glasses, a long dress, and a rat-like tail. “How can I help you?”
